news.title: ACZ holds first AGM to review 2021 financial year
news.content:
Freeman RazembaSenior ReporterTHE Airports Company of Zimbabwe (ACZ) held its first Annual General Meeting (AGM) this morning to review its operations, financial performance, and overall status for the financial year ending December 31, 2021.ACZ, which started operating in 2020, is managing eight airports in Zimbabwe, offering direct and fast access to the countrys tourist resort areas.

It was formed through the Civil Aviation Amendment Act, 2018 (No.10 of 2018) mandated to acquire, establish, develop, maintain, manage, control and operate airports.

Several officials from the Ministry of Transport and Infrastructural Development, Parliamentary Portfolio Committee on Transport and Infrastructural Development member, Cde Munyaradzi Kashambe; ACZ board chairperson Advocate Tichaona John Muhonde; ACZ chief executive officer Mr Tawanda Gusha; ACZ board members, among others, attended the meeting.In a speech read on his behalf by the ministrys strategic policy planning and monitoring and evaluation director Mr Allowance Sango, Transport and Infrastructural Development Deputy Minister Joshua Sacco said the platform provided a critical opportunity to reflect on the companys performance, celebrate milestones, and align on the strategic direction for the year ahead.Let me begin by commending the ACZ board and management for the notable strides made in strengthening Zimbabwes aviation infrastructure, he said.We have witnessed commendable progress in the ongoing rehabilitation and expansion of Robert Gabriel Mugabe International Airport; upgrades at Joshua Mqabuko Nkomo and Victoria Falls International Airports; enhanced service delivery, including passenger handling and compliance with international aviation standards; growing regional traffic and interest in Zimbabwe as a transit and tourism hub.

These developments not only reflect ACZs commitment but also support the Governments thrust under National Development Strategy 1 (NDS1) and Vision 2030 to develop world-class infrastructure that facilitates trade, tourism, and investment.
news.description: THE Airports Company of Zimbabwe (ACZ) held its first Annual General Meeting (AGM) this morning to review its operations, financial performance, and overall status for the financial year ending December 31, 2021.

news.title: Man barred from harassing ex-wife
news.content:
Spiwe Sarakunze

Herald Reporter

A WOMAN from Glen View 7 suburb in Harare has approached the Civil Court seeking a protection order against her ex-husband, accusing him of threatening to kill her for divorcing him.

Ms Beatrice Chiyadzwa accused her ex-husband, Mr Naboth Kuchitumu, of stalking and threatening to kill her.

I divorced him and since then, he has become violent and also hurts me. He is in the habit of stalking and threatening to kill me, she said.

Ms Chiyadzwa accused Mr Kuchitumu of coming to her workplace in Mbare uninvited and causing disturbances while shouting at her in front of other people.

She claimed that her ex-husband came to her new house, sold her blankets and groceries and left her with nothing.

He is abusing me only because l divorced him. He told me that l deserved to die unless l went back to him, she said.

I decided to come for assistance since my life is now in danger and l cannot be forced to live with someone l do not like.

She also told the court that Mr Kachitumu also took her bag in front of people, while calling her a prostitute and insulting her mother.

Ms Chiyadzwa almost broke into tears while testifying saying she was not comfortable giving her home address to the court fearing Mr Kuchitumu would come and hurt her.

Mr Kuchitumu denied the allegations saying that he only visited her place because he wanted to check on the children.

l always want to know how my children are doing and l also wanted her to give me the photocopies of their birth certificates, he said.

Presiding magistrate Ms Meenal Naratom granted Ms Chiyadzwa the protection order and warned Mr Kuchitumu to refrain from threatening and abusing her.
news.description: A WOMAN from Glen View 7 suburb in Harare has approached the Civil Court seeking a protection order against her ex-husband, accusing him of threatening to kill her for divorcing him.

news.title: MCAZ warns celebrities about advertising medicines without its permission
news.content:
Ivan Zhakata

Herald Correspondent

THE Medicines Control Authority of Zimbabwe (MCAZ) has issued a stern warning to celebrities, social media influencers and the general public against advertising medicines without prior written approval.

This follows a surge in illegal promotions on platforms such as Facebook, WhatsApp and X (formerly Twitter).

In a statement, MCAZ director-general Mr Richard Rukwata expressed concern over the rampant violation of advertising regulations, particularly the misuse of online platforms to market unapproved medicines, herbal remedies and complementary treatments.

We have noted with concern the increasing advertisement of medicinesincluding herbal and complementary medicineswithout written approval from the authority, he said.

This is not only illegal but poses serious risks to public health.

Mr Rukwata said the actions contravene Section 40 of the Medicines and Allied Substances Control Act (Chapter 15:03) and Section 65 of the Medicines and Allied Substances Control (General) Regulations, 1991.

Section 65(1b) clearly states that no person shall advertise any medicine without the approval of the authority in writing, he said.

Advertising prescription medicines directly to the public, making unrealistic claims, or promoting medicines as miracle cures are not only unethical but punishable by law.

According to the MCAZ, common signs of unauthorised advertisements include offers of instant results, 100 percent cure rates, claims to treat multiple diseases with a single product and promotions linked to discounts or bonus offers.

The authority has advised consumers to verify the registration numbers of medicines through its official website.

If a medicine claims to cure everything from diabetes to cancer, it is almost certainly a scam, Mr Rukwata said.

We urge the public to be vigilant and to report any suspicious advertisements to the authority.

Mr Rukwata also made it clear that celebrities and socialites are not exempt from the law.

We urge socialites, celebrities and influencers to desist from advertising medicines without our approval. The authority, working with the Zimbabwe Republic Police, will not hesitate to prosecute offenders.

MCAZ reassured the public that it remained committed to protecting public health by ensuring that only safe, effective and approved medicines are advertised and sold within Zimbabwe.

Members of the public have been encouraged to contact the MCAZ directly for more information.
news.description: THE Medicines Control Authority of Zimbabwe (MCAZ) has issued a stern warning to celebrities, social media influencers and the general public against advertising medicines without prior written approval.

news.title: Independence flame heads to Midlands province
news.content:
Richard Muponde

Zimpapers Politics Hub

THE Independence flame was today lit in Harare and left the capital city for the Midlands province for the official launch of the series of activities that will lead up to the main Independence Day commemorations in Gokwe on April 18.

Vice President Dr Constantino Chiwenga will preside over the launch at Mutapa Hall in Gweru on Thursday.

The convoy, which was being escorted by the police, left the Museum of Human Sciences in Harare in style, parading the flame and drawing the attention of citizens who lined up the streets to get a glimpse of the symbolic flame.

In an interview, the Museums and Monuments regional manager for Southern region, Mr Lovemore Mandima, said the flame will arrive in the Midlands in time for the official launch of the Independence Day commemorations.

So, today, the independence flame is moving from the capital city of Zimbabwe to the Midlands province, where the launch of the 2025 independence commemorations shall be done tomorrow by the Vice President, Dr Constantino Chiwenga, at Mutapa Hall, which is a historical site, Mr Mandima said.
news.description: THE Independence flame was today lit in Harare and left the capital city for the Midlands province for the official launch of the series of activities that will lead up to the main Independence Day commemorations in Gokwe on April 18.

news.title: Glenview South residents praise Govt ahead of By-Election
news.content:
Joseph Madzimure

Zimpapers Politics Hub

Glen View South residents have commended the ZANU PF-led Government for spearheading various development projects within the constituency, ahead of the Parliamentary by-election slated for Saturday.

Notable initiatives include the drilling of several solar-powered boreholes, the establishment of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) centres, and the rehabilitation of local roads.

Five candidates will contest for the Glenview South National Assembly seat, including ZANU PF candidate, Cde Tsitsi Tawomhera.

In separate interviews, locals expressed satisfaction with the ongoing work being done by the ruling party in the constituency.

We are excited about the positive changes taking shape in our area, said Mrs Mary Taruvinga. Glenview South used to be in a deplorable state, with sewage gushing from all corners under the oppositions leadership, but now things have improved.

Mr Amos Mabachi, another resident, agreed, stating, It is quite pleasing to note the great improvement in terms of service delivery.

He added, We are going to vote for Cde Tawomhera to realise the benefits of good governance. We felt ill-treated by the MDC-CCC party leadership over the past years. We intend to correct our previous mistakes by voting for a tried and tested party, ZANU PF. We want Cde Tawomhera to represent us in Parliament.

Confidence within the ruling party is high. ZANU PF Harare Provincial Political Commissar, Cde Voyage Dambuza, predicted a resounding victory.

With the developments taking place in the constituency, we will definitely win the by-election, Cde Dambuza said.

We know the area used to be an opposition stronghold, but we have done our homework well. We have a youthful candidate who appeals to the youth, and we are hopeful she will succeed this time.
news.description: Glen View South residents have commended the ZANU PF-led Government for spearheading various development projects within the constituency, ahead of the Parliamentary by-election slated for Saturday.

news.title: Zim UK based cricketer nominated for three African Awards
news.content:
Don Makanyanga

Zimbabwe United Kingdom based cricketer Kudzai Mutiti has been nominated for the second year running for the African Founders of the Year Awards.

The FOYA awards seek to recognise and appreciate young founders contributing to the development of the African continent while creating sustainable jobs through entrepreneurship and inspiring others to start businesses.

Having won the Social Founder of the Year last year, Mutitis cricket academy, Hokima Cricket Academy which focuses on giving opportunities to young, underprivileged cricketers, fostering a sense of community and developing skills, continues to have its works recognised beyond borders.

In recognition of Hokima Cricket Academy, Mutiti has been nominated for three awards this year, namely Social Founder of the Year, Eduprenuer of the Year and Most Promising Founder of the year.

Mutiti who turns out for Great Houghton, a Northampton Cricket Club, and also serves as coach has described the three nominations for the FOYA awards as humbling and emotional.

It is deeply emotional for us (Hokima Cricket Academy), to be recognised in one category and win it last year was a dream come true on its own as it was validation of the work we are doing in making an impact to the community.

And this year to be nominated in not only one, not two, but three categories, I think its beyond anything we have ever imagined. I think it shows that our efforts of empowering the youth through sport is creating a real impact and is not going unnoticed, said Mutiti.

He added that being picked for three awards is great motivation for the academy to make an impact to the community.

Being recognised by FOYA, an organisation that champions youth-led excellence and innovation across the continent reminds us that we are part of something bigger, a movement of young Africans driving change, transforming communities and breaking barriers.

We are grateful for this platform and we are inspired to keep pushing forward, not just for the win, but the legacy were trying to build as Hokima Cricket Academy, said Mutiti
news.description: Zimbabwe’ United Kingdom based cricketer Kudzai Mutiti has been nominated for the second year running for the African Founders of the Year Awards.

news.title: ‘Independence means taking ownership of economy’
news.content:
Gibson Nyikadzino Zimpapers Politics Hub

THE inclusion of the black majority in the mainstream economy coupled with the transfer of ownership of means of production in key sectors to locals is a reality that Zimbabwean youths must defend as the country strides towards economic transformation, the Deputy Secretary for the Commissariat in the ZANU PF Youth League, Cde Taurai Kandishaya, has said.

In an interview ahead of the 45th Independence Day celebrations on April 18 in Nembudziya, Gokwe, Cde Kandishaya said the provision of platforms to access equal economic opportunities for the youth should enable a sense of patriotic responsibility.

He thanked President Mnangagwa for decentralising Independence Day celebrations, and leading the devolution agenda, saying the strategy has been useful in ensuring that development is spread evenly to formerly marginalised places.

This years celebrations are themed Zim@45: Devolve and Develop Together Towards Vision 2030, which underlines the Second Republics commitment to fostering inclusive national development through devolution.

Cde Kandishaya implored the youth to remain brave and emulate the selfless sacrifices made by the nationalist generation in particular through initiating the Land Reform Programme.

As young people, we are no longer fighting using guns because we went to school, we are fighting using ideas. Our forebearers instructed us to offload weapons and embark on the thrust of developing this nation fighting a new economic war where we seek sustainable economic liberation or sustainable economic freedoms, he said.
news.description: THE inclusion of the black majority in the mainstream economy coupled with the transfer of ownership of means of production in key sectors to locals is a reality that Zimbabwean youths must defend as the country strides towards economic transformation, the Deputy Secretary for the Commissariat in the ZANU PF Youth League, Cde Taurai Kandishaya, has said.

news.title: Trial date for activist
news.content:
Prosper Dembedza

A Harare magistrate has set April 11 as the trial date for activist Talent Rusere, who is facing charges of inciting violence and contravening immigration laws after allegedly residing in Botswana without valid travel documents.

Rusere is accused of violating both the Immigration Act and the Data Protection Act by transmitting data messages intended to incite violence or cause damage to property.

According to the prosecution, led by Mr Rufaro Chonzi, Rusere allegedly left Zimbabwe on an unknown date without proper documentation and is believed to have used an unidentified port of exit.

The court heard that Rusere was deported from Botswana on December 23 through the Ramokwebane Border Post in Plumtree after failing to produce a valid passport or any travel documents.

He was arrested upon his return to Zimbabwe.

In addition to immigration law violations, Rusere is facing charges related to digital communication.

It is alleged that while in Zimbabwe, he created and distributed video messages using a computer or information system.

According to the prosecution, the content of these messages was aimed at inciting violence against individuals or property both within Zimbabwe and across the broader Southern African Development Community (SADC) region.

Rusere recently attracted public attention after claiming to have exposed election rigging in Mozambique.
news.description: A Harare magistrate has set April 11 as the trial date for activist Talent Rusere, who is facing charges of inciting violence and contravening immigration laws after allegedly residing in Botswana without valid travel documents.

news.title: Treasury starts disbursing Constituency Development Fund
news.content:
Kuda Bwititi

Zimpapers Politics Hub

TREASURY has activated the disbursement of the much-anticipated Constituency Development Fund (CDF), releasing an initial ZWG 93 million to kick-start development projects nationwide, Finance, Economic Development and Investment Promotion Minister Professor Mthuli Ncube has revealed.

Seventy-one Members of Parliament, representing specific constituencies in the National Assembly, form the first group to receive their allocations.

In an interview with Zimpapers Politics Hub, Professor Ncube said:

Yes, I can confirm that Treasury has started distributing the funding for the CDF. Initially, we started with 71 constituencies. So for these 71, we have released the funds. That amount is, in actual fact, ZWG93 million, which we have paid out.

If you calculate that, it will give you the amount that each legislator will receive.

All legislators that were voted for in the constituencies will benefit from the fund.

Prof Ncube said after finalising the list of 71 MPs. Treasury is now working on the next trench of disbursements for the remaining legislators.

The CDF is expected to ignite yet another wave of tangible development programmes under the Second Republic across all corners of the country.
news.description: TREASURY has activated the disbursement of the much-anticipated Constituency Development Fund (CDF), releasing an initial ZWG 93 million to kick-start development projects nationwide, Finance, Economic Development and Investment Promotion Minister Professor Mthuli Ncube has revealed.

news.title: Trump’s trade tariffs commence
news.content:
Richard Muponde

UNITED States of America President Mr Donald Trumps reciprocal tariffs on imports from Zimbabwe and the rest of the world come into effect today, amidst divided opinions from around the world.

The tariffs hit nearly all US allies and raise import taxes on Chinese goods to more than 100 percent. A new baseline tariff of 10 percent on all imports took effect last Friday, while the reciprocal tariffs entered into force today.

Zimbabwe was slapped with an 18 percent tariff on all its exports to the United States.

However, President Mnangagwa responded by removing all tariffs on US goods entering the country to foster mutual trade relations.

China hit back with its own levies, and the European Union was on the verge of approving a plan to retaliate with tariffs on US steel and aluminium.

Mr Trump has vowed to ensure that the tariffs remain and was quoted boasting that the punitive measures were forcing world leaders to negotiate deals.

The tariffs come into effect as SADC has raised concern over the imposition of these measures by the United States on imported products from the region.
news.description: UNITED States of America President Mr Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs on imports from Zimbabwe and the rest of the world come into effect today, amidst divided opinions from around the world.
